acknowledgments.summary: Sergey Temnikov and Vladimir Dashchenko from Kaspersky Lab reported these vulnerabilities to Siemens.

notes.title: Legal Notice

notes.text: ATTENTION: Remotely exploitable/low skill level to exploit.
notes.title: Risk evaluation

notes.text: Critical Infrastructure Sectors: Chemical, Energy, Food and Agriculture, Water and Wastewater Systems.
notes.title: Critical infrastructure sectors

notes.text: NCCIC recommends users take defensive measures to minimize the risk of exploitation of these vulnerabilities. Specifically, users should:
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: NCCIC reminds organizations to perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: NCCIC also provides a section for control systems security recommended practices on the ICS-CERT web page. Several recommended practices are available for reading and download, including Improving Industrial Control Systems Cybersecurity with Defense-in-Depth Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available in the NCCIC Technical Information Paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies, that is available for download from the ICS-CERT website.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text: Organizations observing any suspected malicious activity should follow their established internal procedures and report their findings to NCCIC for tracking and correlation against other incidents.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

references.summary: ICS Advisory ICSA-18-018-01A - Web Scraped Version

notes.text: Malformed ASN1 streams in V2C and similar input files can be used to generate stack-based buffer overflows. The vulnerability could allow arbitrary code execution.CVE-2017-11496 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 9.8 has been assigned; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Gemalto has released an updated installer and Siemens strongly encourages users upgrade to the new installer as soon as possible. The new installer is available at:
https://supportportal.gemalto.com/csm/?id=kb_article&sys_id=a459d328dba207c8fe0aff3dbf9619ce
Siemens also advises that users configure the operational environment according to Siemens’ Operational Guidelines for Industrial Security:
https://www.siemens.com/cert/operational-guidelines-industrial-security
For more information on these vulnerabilities and more detailed mitigation instructions, please see Siemens Security Advisory SSA-127490 at the following location:
http://www.siemens.com/cert/advisories

notes.text: Language packs containing malformed filenames could lead to a stack-based buffer overflow. The vulnerability could allow arbitrary code execution.CVE-2017-11497 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 9.8 has been assigned; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

For more information on these vulnerabilities and more detailed mitigation instructions, please see Siemens Security Advisory SSA-127490 at the following location:
http://www.siemens.com/cert/advisories

notes.text: Language pack (ZIP file) with invalid HTML files could lead to NULL pointer access. The vulnerability could cause denial of service of the remote process.CVE-2017-11498 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 7.5 has been assigned; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:N/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Gemalto has released an updated installer and Siemens strongly encourages users upgrade to the new installer as soon as possible. The new installer is available at:

Siemens also advises that users configure the operational environment according to Siemens’ Operational Guidelines for Industrial Security:
https://www.siemens.com/cert/operational-guidelines-industrial-security
For more information on these vulnerabilities and more detailed mitigation instructions, please see Siemens Security Advisory SSA-127490 at the following location:
http://www.siemens.com/cert/advisories

notes.text: The administrative interface can be remotely enabled and disabled without authentication. This could increase the attack surface.CVE-2017-12821 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 9.8 has been assigned; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary
